title: As technology advances what are humans increasingly getting worse at? - Quora

response.answer_text: Oh that's easy. Memorizing pretty much anything. When I was a kid (rotary phones…) we memorized maybe 10 or more phone numbers, and that wasn't considered anything special (otherwise you'd have to go to the drawer to pull out the phone book to call a friend). I studied engineering. Exams were not open book, so we better have equations and facts memorized, no reference sheet allowed And even at that, we were worse off than the generation before. I can't even imagine reciting Homer back in the day before it was written down…

Increasingly complex technology effects a population by generations. for a number of obvious reasons young people in their teens and twenties have an easier time learning new skills than people in their 30s and beyond. Ipso facto.
